result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M. ALVAREZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Oxycodone), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentences presently being served on case no: 16 CF 454, to commence on defendants discharge date after extended supervision ends.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety and have no possession or consumption of illegal drugs, unless prescribed and taken in prescribed doses.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Richard Krueger, his residence and place of business without the agent's approval.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

ARRAIGNMENT
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-12-16 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, public defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-19-16 at 2:00 p.m.  
Minutes.
Re:  Possess Oxycodone, on 12-13-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess oxycodone.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-04-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Craig Fraunfelder and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
